official-title.#text: To prohibit the use of funds provided for the official travel expenses of Members of Congress and other officers and employees of the legislative branch for airline accommodations which are not coach-class accommodations, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Prohibiting use of funds for official travel expenses of Members of Congress and legislative branch employees for airline accommodations other than coach-class

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , no funds appropriated or otherwise made available for the official travel expenses of a Member of Congress or other officer or employee of any office in the legislative branch may be used for airline accommodations which are not coach-class accommodations.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may be used for airline accommodations which are not coach-class accommodations for an individual described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: if the use of the funds for such accommodations would be permitted under sections 301–10.121 through 301–10.125 of title 41 of the Code of Federal Regulations if the individual were an employee of an agency which is subject to chapter 301 of such title.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: Nothing in this Act may be construed to affect any officer or employee of an office of the legislative branch which, as of the date of the enactment of this Act, is subject to

external-xref.#tail: of title 41 of the Code of Federal Regulations.

term.#tail: means the basic class of accommodation by airlines that is normally the lowest fare offered regardless of airline terminology used, and (as referred to by airlines) may include tourist class or economy class, as well as single class when the airline offers only one class of accommodations to all travelers.
means a Senator or a Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress.

text.#text: This Act shall apply with respect to fiscal year 2015 and each succeeding fiscal year.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4632 IH: If Our Military Has to Fly Coach Then so Should Congress Act of 2014
